alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 08 at 7:26PM EDT until September 08 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL HUNTERDON, CENTRAL BUCKS, AND NORTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 726 PM EDT, emergency management reported flash flooding occurring across Bucks County. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Lansdale, Doylestown, Byram, Souderton, Bedminster, Flemington, Chalfont, Tinicum, Hatfield, Dublin, Frenchtown, and Stockton. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 29 and 31. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
